mlutils.metrics.forecasting package¶

mlutils.metrics.forecasting.calculate_residuals(forecasts, true_values)¶

Submodules¶

mlutils.metrics.forecasting.metric_aggregation module¶

mlutils.metrics.forecasting.metric_aggregation.agg_forecast_origin_metrics(sample_forecasts, true_values, metric, skipna=False)¶
Parameters

  • sample_forecasts – array like of shape (n_forecast_points, horizon_length)

  • true_values – array like of shape (n_forecast_points + horizon_length) or same shape as :sample_forecasts

  • metric – func with two same sized 1D arrays arguments (sample_forecasts, true_forecast_values) for evaluating sample_forecasts

  • skipna – Skips evaluation of forecast origins with na true values or na forecast values as these can break most metric functions

Returns

metric for each forecast point (n_forecast_points) indexed by the true values associated with those forecast points

mlutils.metrics.forecasting.metric_aggregation.agg_horizon_step_metrics(sample_forecasts, true_values, metric_func, skipna=False)¶
Parameters

  • sample_forecasts – (n_forecast_points, forecast_horizon)

  • true_values – (n_forecast_points + forecast_horizon)

  • metric_func –

  • skipna – skip na values found in sample_forecasts and observations during horizon step metric calculations

Returns

metric for each step in the horizon i.e. (forecast_horizon) sized array
